com.flowpowered.caustic.lwjgl.gl30

Class GL30VertexArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.caustic.api.Creatable

        • com.flowpowered.caustic.lwjgl.gl30.GL30VertexArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GLVersioned

    public class GL30VertexArray
extends VertexArray
    An OpenGL 3.0 implementation of VertexArray.

      • setData

        public void setData(VertexData vertexData)
        Description copied from class: VertexArray
        Sets the vertex data source to use. The indices offset is kept but maybe reduced if it doesn't fit inside the new data. The count is set to the size from the offset to the end of the data.
        Specified by:
        setData in class VertexArray
        Parameters:
        vertexData - The vertex data source

      • setDrawingMode

        public void setDrawingMode(VertexArray.DrawingMode mode)
        Description copied from class: VertexArray
        Sets the vertex array's drawing mode.
        Specified by:
        setDrawingMode in class VertexArray
        Parameters:
        mode - The drawing mode to use

      • setPolygonMode

        public void setPolygonMode(VertexArray.PolygonMode mode)
        Description copied from class: VertexArray
        Sets the vertex array's polygon mode. This describes how to rasterize each primitive. The default is VertexArray.PolygonMode.FILL. This can be used to draw only the wireframes of the polygons.
        Specified by:
        setPolygonMode in class VertexArray
        Parameters:
        mode - The polygon mode

      • setIndicesOffset

        public void setIndicesOffset(int offset)
        Description copied from class: VertexArray
        Sets the starting offset in the indices buffer. Defaults to 0.
        Specified by:
        setIndicesOffset in class VertexArray
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset in the indices buffer

      • setIndicesCount

        public void setIndicesCount(int count)
        Description copied from class: VertexArray
        Sets the number of indices to render during each draw call, starting at the offset set by VertexArray.setIndicesOffset(int). Setting this to a value smaller than zero results in rendering of the whole list. If the value is larger than the list (starting at the offset), it will be maxed to that value.
        Specified by:
        setIndicesCount in class VertexArray
        Parameters:
        count - The number of indices

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Description copied from class: VertexArray
        Draws the primitives defined by the vertex data.
        Specified by:
        draw in class VertexArray

      • getGLVersion

        Description copied from interface: GLVersioned
        Returns the lowest OpenGL version required by this object's implementation.
        Returns:
        The lowest required OpenGL version
